title.narrative: Women economic development through vocational training

description.narrative: Background: Humana People to People Congo (HPP-Congo) was created in September 2006 as a national nonprofit association. HPP-Congo works with communities to build their capacity to improve living conditions, especially for the most vulnerable members of society.

Goal Overview: to teach and capacitate women to improve their economy and living conditions thus the livelihoods of children and the development of the community./ to contribute to the promotion of women’s entrepreneurship and social & economic empowerment and rights.

Project Plan: To contribute to the promotion of women’s entrepreneurship and social & economic empowerment and rights training programs are developed and training centers are set up. 600 Women will be trained in entrepreneurship, skills and 600 community members will be educated in reading, writing and elementary calculations. To make this possible for women, 2 preschools are established for the their children.

Summary:improve economy, social integration and living conditions for women in Kingabwa, Kinshasa, DR Congo by strengthening their capacity to improve their economy. The programs will train 600 women in entrepreneurship, teach 600 illiterate women and young girls to read, write and do elementary calculation and discuss sensitive social topics (gender equality, violence against women, reproductive health etc…) and train the same 600 young women in skills (sewing, beautician/hairdresser, patisserie/bakery and urban gardening).

Target Groups: directly 200 women in entrepreneurship, 200 women in skills training, 300 illiterate women and 80 preschool pupils. The indirect beneficiaries are the entire population of the Child Aid project area in Kingabwa.
